mathematics: BINOMIAL THEOREM AND ITS SIMPLE APPLICATIONS
physics: MAGNETIC EFFECTS OF CURRENT AND MAGNETISM
DUAL NATURE OF MATTER AND RADIATION
chemistry: CLASSIFICATION OF ELEMENTS AND PERIODICITY IN PROPERTIES
PURIFICATION AND CHARACTERISATION OF ORGANIC COMPOUNDS
SOME BASIC PRINCIPLES OF ORGANIC CHEMISTRY

ORGANIC COMPOUNDS CONTAINING NITROGEN (Amines, Diazonium Salts)

met_mtech.name: MET for M-Tech
met_mtech.purpose: Entrance exam for All Master of Technology (M. Tech) and Master of Engineering (M.E) Programs
met_mtech.marking_scheme: +4 for correct, -1 for incorrect, 0 for unattempted.

subject_topics_covered.notes: Tested on core subjects of the chosen discipline and Engineering Mathematics. Detailed topics listed in document but not provided in this section.

met_mtech.gate_score_benefit: Candidates with a valid GATE score (meeting the General Category cutoff) receive 10% additional marks added to their MET score for ranking.

scholarships.overview: Primarily merit-based or awarded based on specific criteria related to background or affiliation.

categories.name: High Merit Scholarships
categories.programs: MBBS, BDS, B.Tech, B.Pharm, and some other UG/PG programs (listed in Annexures A, B)
categories.benefit: Significant fee waivers (ranging from 20% to 100% of program fee) and sometimes hostel fees and stipend (for Kalam-Pai).
categories.eligibility: Primarily based on high NEET (MBBS/BDS) or MET (B.Tech/B.Pharm/other UG/PG) ranks or high academic percentage in qualifying exams.
categories.continuation: Requires maintaining a minimum academic performance (usually 65% aggregate or 7/8 CGPA) and no backlogs/failures in the preceding academic year.

categories.name: Performance-Based Scholarships
categories.programs: B.Tech, B.Pharm, and various other UG/PG programs (listed in Annexures A, B).
categories.benefit: Typically a 20% waiver on the program fee.
categories.eligibility: Awarded from the second year onwards based on outstanding academic performance (high CGPA with no backlogs) in the immediate preceding year at MAHE.

details.benefit: Merit scholarships (25% or 50% fee waiver + 25% hostel concession for Non-AC double room)
details.eligibility: Based on parent's service status and student's academic merit.

details.type: Students from AGE/TMA Pai Foundation Institutions (SAGES/AGE)
details.eligibility: For students who studied in designated feeder institutions.
Parent must be a full-time graduate from a MAHE Manipal institution (listed in Annexure C).
Based on academic merit and Konkani as mother tongue.

categories.name: Manipal Foundation Scholar Program Alumni
categories.eligibility: For students who completed the Manipal Foundation 'Scholar program' with required attendance and academic criteria.

details.benefit: 100% waiver of Program, Hostel, Mess fees
details.eligibility: For economically underprivileged and meritorious students from Government/PU Colleges. Based on MET rank, academic marks, and family income (< Rs. 12 lakhs).

categories.name: Dr Ramdas Pai Scholarships based on Merit
